record.text: OpenAI launches GPT-5 healthcare AI with HIPAA compliance. Boston Children's, UCSF, Stanford Medicine deploying now. Reduces diagnostic errors, automates clinical docs, cites peer-reviewed sources. The future of healthcare just arrived. #AdwaitX #HealthcareAI

external.description: Summary: OpenAI launched OpenAI for Healthcare on January 7, 2026, bringing GPT-5-powered AI to hospitals with full HIPAA compliance. The suite includes ChatGPT for Healthcare (deployed at major institutions like Boston Children's Hospital and UCSF) and the OpenAI API platform for custom healthcare applications. Key features include evidence-based clinical reasoning with transparent citations, automated documentation templates, and institutional policy integration. GPT-5.2 models outperform earlier versions on HealthBench and GDPval medical benchmarks, with real-world studies showing reduced diagnostic errors.
external.title: OpenAI for Healthcare: How GPT-5 AI Is Transforming Clinical Workflows With HIPAA-Compliant Intelligence

external.description: The flagship wireless earbuds from Sony, Apple, and Samsung compete head-to-head in 2026, each offering distinct advantages in battery endurance and audio performance. Sony's WF-1000XM5 delivers 8 hours continuous playback with ANC enabled, matching Apple's recently launched AirPods Pro 3, while Samsung's Galaxy Buds 3 Pro trails at 6 hours despite premium pricing. Sound quality differences emerge through codec support and driver technology, with Sony championing LDAC, Apple refining its AAC implementation, and Samsung introducing the Seamless Codec for Galaxy device users.

In essence, the Napoleon Technique isn't about avoiding work, but optimizing outcomes. Success hinges on intentionality, transparent communication, and a thoughtful assessment of the situation's urgency and potential for self-resolution. #SmartWork 6/6

Further context for the Napoleon Technique: It shines when others involved can resolve the problem independently, or when additional information is likely to emerge and lead to a better, more informed decision. Empowering others is a bonus! #Teamwork 5/6

The effectiveness of strategic delay heavily depends on context. It's best suited for non-urgent issues where immediate action isn't critical. Consider the urgency and potential costs of waiting before applying this technique. #DecisionMaking 4/6

#TheShimmeringSummoner #WeiguangDeZhaohuanShi #SplitterMangaPlus #Manhua
© GENE

images.alt:
Der Verlag Splitter Manga+ bringt den Boys-Love-Manhua »Weiguang de Zhaohuan Shi« von Gene nach Deutschland und feiert damit sein Deutschland-Debüt. Band 1 erscheint nach aktueller Planung am 7. Mai 2026. Band 2 soll im September 2026 folgen.

In Taiwan lief die Reihe von November 2020 bis Dezember 2022 auf der Webplattform Creative Comic Collection und wurde mit insgesamt drei Bänden abgeschlossen. 

📅 Start 》7. Mai 2026
💶 Preis 》10,50€
🏷️ Genre 》Adventure, Fantasy, Romance, Boys-Love
🖊 Autor & Zeichnungen 》Gene
📺 Anime-Adaption 》Keine

📜 Beschreibung  (Splitter Manga +)》
Rubin ist vielleicht der schlechteste Beschwörer aller Zeiten. Sein Vater war ein mächtiger Magier und ein Held, aber Rubins Beschwörungen gehen immer schief – Nie kommt das dabei heraus, was er haben will! Trotzdem hat er große Pläne: Er will in den mythischen Stern-Rang aufsteigen, indem er ein Monster vom Level Dämonendrache besiegt. Bei einem gefährlichen Auftrag beschwört er – mal wieder aus Versehen natürlich – den verwunschenen Prinzen Kyle. Und der führt Rubin direkt zum Schloss eines Boss-Monsters, damit er endlich seinen großen Traum verwirklichen kann! Vielleicht hätte Rubin Kyle gegenüber nicht so sehr mit seinen Fähigkeiten angeben sollen…

📚【Ascendance of a Bookworm】erscheint bei Splitter Manga+ auf Deutsch! ✨

Mehr Infos in der Bildbeschreibung.

#AscendanceOfABookworm #HonzukiNoGekokujou #SplitterMangaPlus #Manga
© 2016 Suzuka, Miya Kazuki, Illustrations by You Shiina / TO Books, Inc.

images.alt:
Der Verlag Splitter Manga+ bringt den Fantasy-Manga »Honzuki no Gekokujou: Shisho ni Naru Tame ni wa Shudan wo Erandeiraremasen Dai 1-bu - Hon ga Nai nara Tsukureba Ii!« von Miya Kazuki (Story) und Suzuka (Illustrationen) nach Deutschland! Band 1 erscheint nach aktueller Planung am 7. Mai 2026. Die Folgebände 2 und 3 sollen im Juli und September 2026 erscheinen.

In Japan lief die Reihe von Oktober 2015 bis Juli 2018 im Magazin Comic Corona von TO Books und wurde mit insgesamt sieben Bänden abgeschlossen. 

📅 Start 》7. Mai 2026
💶 Preis 》10,50€
🏷️ Genre 》Fantasy, Slice of Life
🖊 Autor 》Miya Kazuki
🎨 Zeichnungen 》Suzuka
📺 Anime-Adaption 》1 Staffel bei Crunchyroll

📜 Beschreibung (Splitter Manga+)》
Nach einem tragischen Unfall, bei dem sie unter einer Bücherlawine begraben wurde, wacht Myne in einer fremden Welt auf. Plötzlich ist sie keine Collegestudentin mehr, sondern die Tochter eines Soldaten, fünf Jahre jung und leidet an einer mysteriösen Krankheit! Aber ihre Liebe zum Lesen ist ungebrochen… umso ärgerlicher, dass Bücher in dieser Fantasy-Welt extrem teuer und dem Adel vorbehalten sind. Was soll man bloß tun, wenn man unbedingt lesen will, aber keine Bücher finden kann? Selbst welche herstellen!

Das erste Kapitel von Mynes Quest, ihre neue Heimat mit Bücherliebe zu erfüllen!

record.bridgyOriginalText:
ChatGPT:

What mass adoption would actually look like (important)

It would not look like:

Everyone on Mastodon

A single global timeline

Viral growth curves

Creator monetization explosions

It would look like:

Tens of thousands of instances

Millions of users who don’t know what ActivityPub is

Multiple apps interoperating quietly

Periodic migrations during platform crises

Boring, slow, durable growth

In other words: email-level adoption, not TikTok-level hype.

Renee Macklin Good's wife, Becca Good, released a statement and it moved me to sobbing tears:

archive.is/ur35j

images.alt:
First, I want to extend my gratitude to all the people 
who have reached out from across the country and around the world to support our family. 
This kindness of strangers is the most fitting tribute because if you ever encountered my wife, Renee Nicole Macklin Good, you know that above all else, she was kind, In fact, kindness radiated out of her. 
Renee sparkled. She literally sparkled. I mean, she didn't wear glitter but I swear she had sparkles coming out of her pores. All the time. You might think it was just my love talking but her family said the same thing. Renee was made of sunshine, 
Renee lived by an overarching belief: there is kindness in the world and we need to do everything we can to find it Where it resides and nurture it where it needs to grow Renee was a Christian who knew that all religions teach the same essential truth: we are here to love each other, care for each other, and keep each other safe and whole. 
Like people have done across place and time, we moved to make a better life for ourselves. We chose Minnesota to make our home. Our whole extended road trip here, we held hands in the car while our son drew all over the windows to pass the time and the miles,

What we found when we got here was a vibrant and welcoming community, we made friends and spread joy: And while any place we were together was home, there was a strong shared sense here in Minneapolis that we were looking out for each other. Here, I had finally found peace and safe harbor. That has been taken from me forever. 
We were raising our son to believe that no matter where you come from or what you look like, all of us deserve compassion and kindness. Renee lived this belief every day. She is pure love. She is pure joy. She is pure sunshine 
On Wednesday, January 7th, we stopped to support our neighbors. We had whistles. They had guns. 
Renee leaves behind three extraordinary children; the youngest is just six years old and already lost his father. I am now left to raise our son and to continue teaching him, as Renee believed, that there are people building a better world for him. That the people who did this had fear and anger in their hearts, and we need to show them a better way. 
We thank you for the privacy you are granting our family as we grieve. We thank you for ensuring that Renee's legacy is one of kindness and love. We honor her memory by living her values: rejecting hate and choosing compassion, turning away from fear and pursuing peace, refusing division and knowing we must come together to build a world where we all come home safe to the people we love. E

Renee Macklin Good's wife, Becca Good, released a statement and it moved me to sobbing tears:

archive.is/ur35j

images.alt:
First, I want to extend my gratitude to all the people 
who have reached out from across the country and around the world to support our family. 
This kindness of strangers is the most fitting tribute because if you ever encountered my wife, Renee Nicole Macklin Good, you know that above all else, she was kind, In fact, kindness radiated out of her. 
Renee sparkled. She literally sparkled. I mean, she didn't wear glitter but I swear she had sparkles coming out of her pores. All the time. You might think it was just my love talking but her family said the same thing. Renee was made of sunshine, 
Renee lived by an overarching belief: there is kindness in the world and we need to do everything we can to find it Where it resides and nurture it where it needs to grow Renee was a Christian who knew that all religions teach the same essential truth: we are here to love each other, care for each other, and keep each other safe and whole. 
Like people have done across place and time, we moved to make a better life for ourselves. We chose Minnesota to make our home. Our whole extended road trip here, we held hands in the car while our son drew all over the windows to pass the time and the miles,

What we found when we got here was a vibrant and welcoming community, we made friends and spread joy: And while any place we were together was home, there was a strong shared sense here in Minneapolis that we were looking out for each other. Here, I had finally found peace and safe harbor. That has been taken from me forever. 
We were raising our son to believe that no matter where you come from or what you look like, all of us deserve compassion and kindness. Renee lived this belief every day. She is pure love. She is pure joy. She is pure sunshine 
On Wednesday, January 7th, we stopped to support our neighbors. We had whistles. They had guns. 
Renee leaves behind three extraordinary children; the youngest is just six years old and already lost his father. I am now left to raise our son and to continue teaching him, as Renee believed, that there are people building a better world for him. That the people who did this had fear and anger in their hearts, and we need to show them a better way. 
We thank you for the privacy you are granting our family as we grieve. We thank you for ensuring that Renee's legacy is one of kindness and love. We honor her memory by living her values: rejecting hate and choosing compassion, turning away from fear and pursuing peace, refusing division and knowing we must come together to build a world where we all come home safe to the people we love. E

Like people have done across place and time, we moved to make a better life for ourselves. We chose Minnesota to make our home. Our whole extended road trip here, we held hands in the car while our son drew all over the windows to pass the time and the miles,

What we found when we got here was a vibrant and welcoming community, we made friends and spread joy: And while any place we were together was home, there was a strong shared sense here in Minneapolis that we were looking out for each other. Here, I had finally found peace and safe harbor. That has been taken from me forever. 
We were raising our son to believe that no matter where you come from or what you look like, all of us deserve compassion and kindness. Renee lived this belief every day. She is pure love. She is pure joy. She is pure sunshine 
On Wednesday, January 7th, we stopped to support our neighbors. We had whistles. They had guns. 
Renee leaves behind three extraordinary children; the youngest is just six years old and already lost his father. I am now left to raise our son and to continue teaching him, as Renee believed, that there are people building a better world for him. That the people who did this had fear and anger in their hearts, and we need to show them a better way. 
We thank you for the privacy you are granting our family as we grieve. We thank you for ensuring that Renee's legacy is one of kindness and love. We honor her memory by living her values: rejecting hate and choosing compassion, turning away from fear and pursuing peace, refusing division and knowing we must come together to build a world where we all come home safe to the people we love. E

external.description: Getty Images The British Medical Association union is recommending members accept a ew pay deal Scotland's resident doctors have called off a planned four-day strike over pay. They had been set to go on the first national walkout staged by NHS workers on Tuesday, having accused ministers of going back on promises over pay. But after further negotiations, the British Medical Association union is to suspend the strike and put a fresh pay offer to members - and is recommending that it is accepted. Health secretary Neil Gray said it was "great news" which would avoid disruption to patient care.
